author: Fiona Simpson
title: Mary Berry faces backlash over bizarre spaghetti bolognese recipe
text:
Wednesday 8 March 2017 08:59 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Controversy: Mary Berry left viewers 'shocked and appalled' by adding white whine and cream to a bolognese dish BBC 
Food lovers were left “shocked and appalled” after TV chef Mary Berry opted to put white wine and double cream in spaghetti bolognese. 
The 81-year-old added the odd ingredients to the traditional Italian dish on BBC 2’s Mary Berry’s Everyday. 
The novel recipe also favoured pork mince over beef and Pappadelle pasta over spaghetti and was baked in an oven. 
While preparing the ragu sauce, Berry said: “White or red (wine), whatever you've got to hand - although I really prefer to add white. Read more 
"There's never any left in our household. I might even have to open a bottle especially. 
"My secret is to make it even richer by adding double cream." White wine and double cream for the best bolognese sauce? #MaryBerry please put that glass of wine down... #JeSuisRagù #PrayForRagù 
The strange concoction sparked outrage among fans – some of whom claimed they were forced to switch channels. 
Alex Preston said on Twitter: "Shocked and appalled about Mary Berry adding double cream to her bolognese." Is this Brexit pasta #MaryBerry ? What's next white wine in pizza filled with Sunday roast leftovers ? #shudder #mary — Santi Pokar (@spokar) March 7, 2017 
Another user added: “Just watched a cooking programme where Mary Berry put white wine in bolognese. Turned it off.” More about:
